definitions: of, characteristic of, or occurring in autumn
suggesting the qualities associated with autumn such as maturity or decline
examples: The autumnal colors painted the hillside in warm hues
We enjoyed the autumnal harvest festival
Her autumnal years were filled with reflection and wisdom
The poem had an autumnal melancholy

definitions: providing supplementary or additional help and support
examples: The auxiliary power unit provides backup electricity
She joined the auxiliary police force as a volunteer

definitions: able to be used or obtained; at someone's disposal
not otherwise occupied; free to do something
examples: The tickets are available online or at the box office
Limited resources were available for the project
Is the doctor available this afternoon?
She's not available for comment right now

definitions: having been the subject of revenge or retribution for a wrong
examples: The avenged victims finally received justice
His avenged honor restored his family's reputation

definitions: typical or normal; neither particularly good nor bad
calculated by adding quantities together and dividing by their number
examples: The average student takes four years to graduate
It was just an average day at the office
The average temperature this month is twenty degrees
Their average score was eighty-five percent

definitions: having a strong dislike or opposition to something
examples: She's not averse to taking calculated risks
He was averse to any form of confrontation

definitions: relating to birds or characteristic of birds
examples: Avian flu poses risks to both birds and humans
The museum's avian collection includes rare species

definitions: having or showing a keen interest in or enthusiasm for something
examples: She's an avid reader of mystery novels
The avid collector owned thousands of stamps

definitions: able to be avoided, prevented, or kept away from
examples: Many traffic accidents are entirely avoidable
The conflict was avoidable with better communication

definitions: that has been asserted, admitted, or stated publicly
examples: He was an avowed supporter of the reform movement
Her avowed intention was to revolutionize the industry

definitions: waited for, especially with eagerness or anxiety
examples: The long-awaited sequel finally premiered last night
Her awaited return brought joy to the family

definitions: not asleep; conscious and aware of surroundings
aware of and attentive to something important
examples: The baby was awake all night with a fever
She lay awake worrying about the exam
They were awake to the dangers of the situation
Stay awake to opportunities for advancement

definitions: roused from sleep or unconsciousness
made aware of something for the first time
examples: The awakened child cried for her mother
We were awakened by loud thunder
Her awakened consciousness embraced new possibilities
The awakened public demanded political reform

definitions: having knowledge or perception of a situation or fact
examples: She was aware of the risks involved
Are you aware that the meeting was cancelled?

definitions: covered or flooded with water
having an abundance or excess of something
examples: The deck was awash with seawater during the storm
Streets were awash after the heavy rainfall
The market is awash with cheap imports
The city was awash with rumors

definitions: inspiring awe or wonder, especially through being magnificent or terrible
extremely impressive or excellent; wonderful
examples: The awesome power of nature humbled the observers
We stood before the awesome mountain peaks
That was an awesome performance by the band
The new restaurant has awesome food

definitions: extremely bad or unpleasant
inspiring awe or fear; terrible in the old sense
examples: The awful weather ruined our vacation plans
That movie was absolutely awful
The awful majesty of the storm frightened everyone
An awful silence descended upon the battlefield

definitions: lacking skill or dexterity; clumsy in movement or manner
causing difficulty or inconvenience; hard to deal with
causing or feeling embarrassment or inconvenience socially
examples: His awkward movements showed he was a beginner
The awkward package was difficult to carry
It's an awkward situation with no easy solution
The awkward timing complicated our plans
There was an awkward silence after his comment
She felt awkward at the formal dinner

definitions: absent without official leave from military duty or other obligation
examples: The soldier went awol for three days
Two employees have been awol since Monday

definitions: away from the appropriate, planned, or expected course; amiss
examples: Their plans went awry when funding was cut
Something had gone awry with the experiment

definitions: bright blue in color, like a cloudless sky
examples: The azure waters of the Mediterranean sparkled
She wore an azure dress to the summer party

definitions: supported, especially financially
having a back of a specified type
examples: The government-backed loan helped small businesses
Their venture is backed by major investors
She sat in a high-backed chair
The leather-backed notebook was expensive

definitions: made with or using the back of the hand or a backhanded stroke
examples: Her backhand shot won the tennis match
The backhand compliment stung more than criticism

definitions: relating to or situated in the area behind the stage in a theater
examples: The backstage area was crowded with performers
She got a backstage pass to meet the band

definitions: directed behind or to the rear
having made less progress than normal or expected
reluctant to change or try new things
examples: He took a backward glance before leaving
The backward movement surprised everyone
The backward region lacked modern infrastructure
Their backward technology hindered progress
His backward attitudes offended younger colleagues
Don't be backward about asking for help

definitions: relating to, caused by, or consisting of bacteria
examples: Bacterial infections require antibiotic treatment
The bacterial culture grew rapidly in the lab

definitions: totally confused or perplexed; unable to understand
examples: The baffled detective couldn't solve the case
She looked baffled by the complex instructions

definitions: impossible to understand or explain; perplexing
examples: The baffling mystery remained unsolved for years
His baffling behavior worried his friends

definitions: loose and hanging in folds, typically of clothing
examples: His baggy pants were popular in the nineties
The baggy sweater hid her figure

definitions: cooked by dry heat in an oven
hardened or dried by subjecting to heat
examples: The baked chicken was perfectly golden
Fresh baked bread filled the kitchen with aroma
The baked clay pottery was ready for painting
Sun-baked earth cracked in the drought

definitions: extremely hot, especially describing weather or temperature
examples: It was a baking hot day in the desert
The baking sun made working outside unbearable

definitions: arranged in equal or correct proportions
emotionally stable and sensible
examples: A balanced diet includes all food groups
The balanced budget avoided deficit spending
She maintained a balanced perspective despite the crisis
His balanced approach considered all viewpoints

definitions: having little or no hair on the head
plain and undisguised; without elaboration
examples: The bald man wore a hat in the sun
His head was completely bald by age forty
That's a bald lie with no truth to it
The bald facts speak for themselves

definitions: in the process of losing one's hair; becoming bald
examples: The balding professor combed his remaining hair carefully
He started balding in his early thirties

definitions: relating to projectiles and their flight
flying into a rage; becoming extremely angry
examples: The ballistic missile traveled thousands of miles
Ballistic tests confirmed the weapon type
He went ballistic when he heard the news
Mom will go ballistic if we're late

definitions: so lacking in originality as to be obvious and boring
examples: His banal comments added nothing to the discussion
The movie's banal plot disappointed critics

definitions: wrapped or bound with bandages for protection or support
examples: His bandaged arm was in a sling
The bandaged wound needed daily cleaning

definitions: marked with stripes or bands of different color or texture
examples: The banded snake had red and black stripes
Banded agate is popular in jewelry

definitions: having legs that curve outward at the knees
examples: His bandy legs were a result of childhood rickets
The cowboy's bandy legs showed years of riding

definitions: making or characterized by loud, sharp knocking or hitting sounds
examples: The banging noise kept everyone awake
A banging headache ruined his morning

definitions: declared in law unable to pay debts; financially ruined
completely lacking in a particular quality or value
examples: The bankrupt company closed all its stores
He went bankrupt after the failed investment
The government was morally bankrupt
Their bankrupt ideology offered no solutions

definitions: officially or legally prohibited from being done or used
examples: The banned substance was found in his blood test
Several banned books were removed from libraries

definitions: outstandingly good or successful
examples: It was a banner year for the company
The team had a banner season

definitions: small in size but aggressive or spirited
examples: The bantam rooster defended the henhouse fiercely
Despite his bantam size, he was a fierce competitor

definitions: having received the Christian sacrament of baptism
examples: The baptised infant wore a white christening gown
All baptised members could receive communion

definitions: relating to the Christian ceremony of baptism
examples: The baptismal font was centuries old
She wore her baptismal certificate proudly

definitions: having received the Christian sacrament of baptism
examples: The baptized believers formed the congregation
She was baptized as an adult

definitions: relating to ancient peoples considered uncivilized or primitive
examples: The barbarian invasions ended the Roman Empire
Their barbarian customs shocked the missionaries

definitions: savagely cruel and exceedingly brutal
examples: The barbaric treatment of prisoners violated international law
Such barbaric practices belong in the past

definitions: extremely brutal or cruel
primitive and uncivilized in culture or behavior
examples: The barbarous attack shocked the nation
Their barbarous treatment of animals was illegal
The barbarous tribe had no written language
Such barbarous customs seemed medieval
